items.title: Markets cut losses: Sensex recovers 350 pts from day's low, Nifty above 22,450; Bank Nifty under pressure
items.description: The broader market saw mixed trends, with midcaps holding steady while smallcaps extended losses, slipping 0.7 percent but recovering slightly from the day’s lows.

items.title: M&M, Ashok Leyland, MGL shares tumble up to 3% on Maharashtra's motor tax hike
items.description: Maharashtra's decision to increase motor tax levied on compressed natural gas (CNG) four wheelers by a percent has weighed on shares of car companies and Mahanagar Gas.

items.title: Gensol Engineering stock extends losses, down 5% as promoter infusion of Rs 29 crore fails to excite
items.description: Gensol's stock has fallen to a multi-month low due to multiple ratings downgrades as the company has faced scrutiny over delays in servicing its term loan obligations.

items.title: Macrotech Developers' shares rise 4% on Rs 279-crore land parcel acquisition in Mumbai
items.description: The plot, located at Prabhat Estate off Swami Vivekananda Road, includes an 82,000 sq ft office building that served as Unichem’s registered office until now.

items.title: Should you look at IndusInd Bank facing multiple challenges?
items.description: Given the lingering uncertainty with the top management and repeated accidents, a valuation rerating is unlikely in the near term

items.title: Infosys, Wipro, other IT stocks tank sharply as uncertainty on Trump's tariffs sours sentiment
items.description: Anxiety mounts that Trump's tariffs and government firings will torpedo growth in the US economy, leading to muted growth for expert-oriented IT stocks.

items.title: Bharat Electronics' shares edge marginally higher on Rs 843-crore order win
items.description: The company had previously won a Rs 577 crore order on March 6 for airborne electronic warfare systems, submarine communication solutions, Doppler weather radar, and train communication systems.

items.title: Sensex crashes nearly 450 pts, Nifty below 22,350 after Wall Street sell-off; mid, smallcap indices down 2%
items.description: Market experts suggest that global headwinds continue to drag the market sentiment, with the rise in US unemployment rates and tariffs leading to uncertainty, indicating that volatility is here to stay for the near term.

items.title: Sun Pharma: Checkpoint acquisition strengthens speciality portfolio
items.description: In the near term, pricing pressure in generics and moderation in contribution from Revlimid is a key watch, along with potential tariff announcements by the US

items.title: Agri Picks Report March 11, 2025: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: According to Geojit Financial Services, Sowing of rabi crops in Telangana was at 7.3 million acres (1 acre = 0.4 hectares) as of Wednesday, up 10.3% from 6.6 million acres a year ago, according to a report released by the state agriculture department.

items.title: Sun Pharma is putting its cash pile to good use
items.description: Acquisitions and licensing deals over the last two years strengthened Sun Pharma's specialty drug pipeline

items.title: IndusInd Bank shares crash 20% as discrepancies in derivatives portfolio could impact profit by Rs 1,500 crore
items.description: Brokerages cut their target price on IndusInd Bank shares on the recent CFO resignation, the CEO getting only a one-year extension instead of three, and a derivatives-induced dislocation.

items.title: Scorching Summer: Stocks that could benefit from intense heat waves
items.description: AC industry sees strong demand, while FMCG and the power sector are likely beneficiaries

items.title: Stock Market LIVE Updates: Sensex down 200 pts, Nifty near 22430; IndusInd Bank, Zomato, Infosys top losers
items.description: Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates: IndusInd Bank, Infosys, Tech Mahindra, Wipro, M&M are among major losers on the Nifty, while gainers are ICICI Bank, BPCL, Sun Pharma, Adani Enterprises, Britannia Industries. BSE Midcap index down 0.7 percent, while smallcap index down nearly 2 percent. Except oil & gas, realty, all other sectoral indicesd are trading in the red.

items.title: First Tick: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade
items.description: The Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) sold equities worth Rs 485 crore on March 10, while domestic institutional investors (DIIs) bought equities worth Rs 263 crore, on the same day.

items.title: Stocks to Watch Today: IndusInd Bank, Hitachi Energy, NTPC, Syngene, MSTC, HEG, Anupam Rasayan, Nectar Life, Indoco Remedies in focus on 11 March
items.description: Stocks to Watch, Mar 11: Stocks like Centum Electronics, NTPC Green Energy, Indian Bank, Urja Global, Bharat Electronics, NLC India, Ashoka Buildcon, Hisar Metal Industries, Anupam Rasayan India, Emcure Pharmaceuticals, Gensol Engineering, and Thermax will be in focus on March 11.

items.title: Trade Spotlight: How should you trade Emami, Sarda Energy, SRF, Nestle India, InterGlobe Aviation, JSW Steel, and others on March 11?
items.description: The benchmark indices, as well as broader markets, might extend the weakness. Below are some trading ideas for the near term.

items.title: Buy Jyothy Labs; target of Rs 395: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: Geojit Financial Services is bullish on Jyothy Labs has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 395 in its research report dated March 11, 2025.

items.title: CLSA expects GenAI to drive Indian IT's potential growth; TCS and Persistent Systems among top picks
items.description: CLSA has set a target price of Rs 9,267 for Persistent Systems calling it a 'high-conviction outperform' stock, while for TCS, it has set a target price of Rs 4,546 rating it as 'outperform'.

items.title: Kotak Institutional fears NMDC's earnings may peak in FY25, turns cautious on mining sector
items.description: Kotak Institutional has issued a ‘Sell’ call on NMDC with a price target of Rs 55, projecting a downside of 15.4 percent from the last closing price of Rs 65 per share.

items.title: Macrotech, Godrej Properties, DLF, other real estate stocks jump up to 5% to lead market recovery
items.description: Nifty Realty index rose nearly 3 percent, snapping its 3-day losing streak. The sectoral index is currently the top gainer among its peers on NSE.

items.title: Sun Pharma shares rise over 3% with positive brokerage outlook as firm to acquire US biotech company
items.description: Brokerages have revealed a favourable outlook for the stock with the acquisition expected to be completed by the second half of 2025.
